comment: An easy class, the exams are open note, and there aren't any assignments, just discussions.

Easiest class ever. Read the textbook and take a quiz for each section of the chapter (5 MC per quic) and then one test (all MC) per chapter . For the entire semester, you need to complete only 5 discussions and there is a midterm and final (all MC) which were super easy. Almost impossible to fail the class.

I've had Professor Clapp twice, and they are always so kind, passionate, and highly informative. The work is easy but not too easy that it gets boring, and the lectures are always interesting and helpful. Clapp is very approachable, and only wants the best for their students!
I absolutely loved her class this semester. She is very informative when it comes to lectures, and she also gives really good feedback when you do your speeches. Everyone loved her.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: This class is very straightforward and easy to get a good grade in. She is easy to reach through email. Overall, really great and highly recommend.
She was a fine professor but if you missed anything, even if a family member died or parent overdosed, she will not open missed grades.

Took COMM 2230 online with professor Clapp. The content of this class is super interesting. Her assignments are easy and instructions are always clear. Discussion posts each week as well as usually quizzes and materials to watch/read but its all super easy. Only thing is her tests are a bit difficult I think. Would definitely recommend though.

took her for masscomm and it's sooo easy. every week it's chapter, discussion post, and quiz with a test every 2.5-3 wks. textbook required and you have to pay, but if you look hard enough you'll find the pdf. responds pretty quick to emails and is always willing to help.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Always try to choose professor Clapp for my Comm classes. Really good teacher and the class is very repetitive. Each week you have a discussion and quiz. Then one week to finish a test every month. Very easy if you read the textbook, and honestly skimming the textbook is fine too. No in-depth lecture videos. Discussions are creative and easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Clapp is a great teacher and truly respects their students. I took their public speaking class online and you have 4 speeches to do. The only annoying thing was that you required an "audience" in each video recording which can either be live/virtual. She isnt an harsh grader as long as you stick to the outline and her expectations.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Super easy class!! Definitely take her!!

Love her. You know everything about the class and when it's due on the first day. As long as you do the work it's an easy A. It is just pieces of a paper due periodically and your final is submitting the whole paper. A few quizzes, but they're easy. She gives feedback and you can tell she WANTS you to pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Professor Clapp is literally one of the best professors I have taken. I really wish she taught some courses in the Media and Entertainment program. They are the best choice for any class. Literally no complains.

She makes public speaking so much less scary! Grades are from speeches, speech outlines, and short speech reflections. Midterm and final hardly count. Lenient on grading of speeches - I got As on all of them but thought I had done horribly. Quick grader, gives things back almost immediately. Super cool & chill - would take her again in a heartbeat!

I really liked this teacher. she's very open and always started a conversation with the class. She was lenient with  assignments and attendance was mandatory at the start, but then slowly wasn't. the only hw we had was peer review, outlining for speeches and other little assignments. very recommended!
Professor Clapp has extremely boring lectures, but her class is pretty easy. It consists of a few quizzes and a Literature Review paper.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: TAKE HER. Her lectures are way better than most professors, she cares about what she teaches, and is incredibly flexible when life throws a curveball your way. She made it incredibly easy for me to actually focus on learning and being proud of what I write, rather than just whipping up a paper to get a grade. I repeat myself, TAKE HER.

Quit reading reviews and take her class, no matter what the course is you will not regret taking professor Clapp. Her work is straight forward and not overwhelming, and she makes lectures as interesting as they can be.

Prof Clapp's class was dumb-easy. Literally show up to class and make sure you are there are on your speech day. The actual material is common sense and can be easily memorized. She is very helpful and cares about her students, super understanding about unexpected life events.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Clapp gives insightful information on writing and what good writing requires. Great feedback, easily accessible and makes the content easy to understand. I cannot recommend her enough for this course!
Prof. Clapp is super awesome! She's very funny and is always extremely accommodating. Definitely reccommend!
Prof Clapp is amazing! She is so sweet and always is very accommodating to her students. Honestly one of the best professors at KSU!

She kept the lectures interesting & related the content to real life & she's very funny. She is also super understanding - 2x my wifi was slow & I couldn't do my homework & both times she gave me an extension. Easy A if you do the homework (only takes 20-30 minutes per week). Only two tests but they're easy & multiple choice

Very straight forward class, Only a midterm and a final with weekly textbook quizzes and a few online discussions. The subject was very boring but I had to take it for credit: she is nice professor and explains the subject well.
